docs.title: About DEEPS
docs.text:
DEEPS (Departmental Exam Processing System) is an experimental desktop application exploring simplified academic data management approaches. This is a personal research project investigating whether exam processing can be made simpler and more decentralized.

Important: Experimental System

  • Testing Phase Only: Currently tested with dummy data, not real student records
  • User Responsibility: You are fully responsible for your data security and handling
  • No Data Collection: DEEPS processes everything locally - no data is recorded or transmitted
  • Personal Research: This is not an approved institutional system

docs.title: Windows Installation
docs.text:
1. Download the Windows installer (.msi file)
  2. Right-click the installer and select "Run as administrator"
  3. Follow the setup wizard:
  4. Accept the license agreement
  5. Choose installation location (default recommended)
  6. Select components to install
  7. Complete installation and restart if prompted
  8. Launch DEEPS from the Start menu or desktop shortcut

Installation Tips

  • Temporarily disable antivirus during installation if prompted
  • Choose "Install for all users" for multi-user environments
  • Keep the default installation path for automatic updates

docs.title: macOS Installation
docs.text:
1. Download the macOS disk image (.dmg file)
  2. Open the downloaded .dmg file
  3. Drag DEEPS to the Applications folder
  4. Launch DEEPS from Applications
  5. Allow the app when macOS security prompts appear

Security Notice

On first launch, you may see "DEEPS cannot be opened because it is from an unidentified developer":

  • Right-click DEEPS in Applications
  • Select "Open" from the context menu
  • Click "Open" in the security dialog

docs.title: Option 1: AppImage (Recommended)
docs.text:
1. Download the AppImage file
  2. Make it executable: chmod +x DEEPS-v2.1-x86_64.AppImage
  3. Run: ./DEEPS-v2.1-x86_64.AppImage

docs.title: Option 2: Debian Package
docs.text:
1. Download the .deb package
  2. Install: sudo dpkg -i deeps_2.1_amd64.deb
  3. Resolve dependencies: sudo apt-get install -f
  4. Launch: deeps or find in applications menu

docs.title: Frequently Asked Questions
docs.text: Common questions about DEEPS and their answers.

docs.title: Q: What are the minimum system requirements?
docs.text: A: Windows 10/macOS 10.15/Ubuntu 18.04+, 4GB RAM, 2GB disk space. See System Requirements for details.

docs.title: Q: Is DEEPS really free for educational institutions?
docs.text: A: Yes, DEEPS is provided free for testing and evaluation. This is an experimental system - users are responsible for their own data security and handling.

docs.title: Q: Does DEEPS work offline?
docs.text: A: Yes, after initial setup and license verification, DEEPS works completely offline. No internet required for daily operations.

docs.title: Q: Where is student data stored?
docs.text: A: All data is stored locally on your institutional servers. No student information is transmitted externally or stored in the cloud.

docs.title: Q: Is DEEPS FERPA compliant?
docs.text: A: Yes, DEEPS is designed with educational privacy requirements in mind, including FERPA compliance for US institutions.

docs.title: Q: Can multiple users access the same database?
docs.text: A: Yes, DEEPS supports multi-user access with role-based permissions. See Multi-User Setup for configuration.

docs.title: Q: What Excel formats are supported?
docs.text: A: DEEPS supports .xlsx and .xls files. We recommend using .xlsx format for best compatibility.

docs.title: Q: Can I import data from other student information systems?
docs.text: A: DEEPS imports Excel files. If your SIS can export to Excel format, you can use that data with DEEPS.

docs.title: Q: What if lecturers use different Excel formats?
docs.text: A: DEEPS has flexible column mapping to handle different Excel layouts. You can also provide lecturers with a standard template.

docs.title: Q: How does DEEPS handle transfer students?
docs.text: A: DEEPS can track transfer credits and maintain complete academic history. Transfer credits can be imported and mapped to your institution's courses.

docs.title: Q: Can DEEPS track students across multiple years?
docs.text: A: Yes, DEEPS maintains complete academic history from enrollment to graduation, tracking progression across all years.

docs.title: Q: What about students who repeat courses?
docs.text: A: DEEPS handles course repeats and supplementary exams, automatically calculating the best grades and tracking academic standing.

docs.title: Q: Can I customize transcript formats?
docs.text: A: Yes, DEEPS allows customization of report templates to match your institutional formatting requirements.

docs.title: Q: Does DEEPS generate official transcripts?
docs.text: A: Yes, DEEPS creates official transcripts with institutional branding, security features, and proper formatting for external use.

docs.title: Q: Can I export data for other systems?
docs.text: A: Yes, DEEPS can export data in PDF, Excel, and CSV formats for integration with other institutional systems.

docs.title: Q: What if DEEPS crashes during data processing?
docs.text: A: DEEPS has automatic backup features. No data should be lost, and you can restore from the most recent backup.

docs.title: Q: How often should I backup DEEPS data?
docs.text: A: DEEPS creates automatic backups daily. We recommend additional manual backups before major data imports or at semester end.

docs.title: Q: Can I run DEEPS on a Mac or Linux?
docs.text: A: Yes, DEEPS supports Windows, macOS, and Linux. Download the appropriate version for your operating system.

docs.title: Q: How does DEEPS calculate GPA?
docs.text: A: DEEPS uses standard GPA calculation methods and can be configured for your institution's specific grading scale and credit system.

docs.title: Q: Can DEEPS handle different grading systems?
docs.text: A: Yes, DEEPS supports letter grades, percentage grades, and various institutional grading scales.

docs.title: Q: What about prerequisite tracking?
docs.text: A: DEEPS can track course prerequisites and flag when students attempt courses without meeting requirements.

docs.title: Q: How do I update DEEPS?
docs.text: A: Updates are distributed as new installation packages. Download and install the latest version from the official repository.

docs.title: Q: Is there user training available?
docs.text: A: This documentation provides comprehensive guides. Additional training can be arranged through deeps-support@dkut.ac.ke.

docs.title: Q: What if I need a feature that's not available?
docs.text: A: Contact samuel.macharia@dkut.ac.ke to discuss feature requests. This is a research project exploring academic data processing improvements.

docs.title: Q: Can I share DEEPS with other institutions?
docs.text: A: Yes, DEEPS is freely available for educational institutions. Share the official download links with other schools.

docs.title: Q: Are there any usage restrictions?
docs.text: A: DEEPS is free for educational use. Commercial use or redistribution of modified versions requires permission.

docs.title: Q: Will DEEPS remain free in the future?
docs.text:
A: Yes, our commitment is to keep DEEPS free for educational institutions to support academic data management worldwide.

Still have questions? Contact us at samuel.macharia@dkut.ac.ke or check our Contact page.
